intro: Diachroa, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants are characterized by their large, showy inflorescences composed of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. Diachroa species typically have thick, fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value, though some species contain toxic compounds.
